intro: Acanthodesmos, commonly known as the spiny leaf shrub, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, spiny leaves that provide a protective feature against herbivores. The flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, often with yellow or white petals. These plants are native to regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
